loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 27 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with four children who are all in school.

Festus has a motorcycle business that he has been doing for the past three years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to service his motorcycle. He is optimistic that his transportation business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business and buy another motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Chek's Group

texts.en:
Chek, a resident of the Dambae District of Kampong Cham Province, is a 56-year-old widowed mother of five children. She has struggled to feed her family by growing cassava on 1 hectare [~ 2.5 acres] of farmland for ten years. She supplements her income by selling coconuts. 

Chek has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has successfully used her past loans to relieve her family’s financial burden with the income that she has received for the improvement of her business. 

Now Chek and her fellow group member are seeking a loan with VisionFund in amount of 1,400,000 riels (KHR) and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava field and use a part of her loan to help her children start up a fish-selling business. Chek hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living and also hopes to help her children to have a proper business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is from Swp, Calamba. She is 45 years old. Josefina is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Josefina runs a general store and sells a variety of foods and home-use products in the local community. Josefina has been in this business for 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. Josefina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Recently, Josefina joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated her retail business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She is 45 years of age and married to John. They have four school-going children.

Jane has a retail shop that she has been running for the past two years. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of rice, peas, and beans for sale in her retail shop, as this will ensure stability in her business.  She will therefore get more income and provide good education for her children.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale business, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, peas, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Both of her children (one daughter and one son) are dependent on her and still in school. She has been engaged in rice farming and cassava planting for twelve years to support her family. The current business earns her about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Ran’s group consists of two women and this is the first microloan for this group with VisionFund. Ran and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her lifestyle and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add merchandise like perfumes, detergents, knives, etc.

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Petronilla owns and operates a manufacturing business. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns PHP 3,000 a month for these activities. 

Recently, Petronilla joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy generates income by working in a hog-raising business. She has been involved in this for almost 10 years. Her years of experience leads her to be strong in running this business. In the past few years, Thy encountered difficulties in raising her pigs due a serious illness that affected her province from the neighboring countries. However, Thy’s business still survives and enables her to provide for her family's basic needs. She is 42 years old and has become a widow with four single children. Her two daughters, Vin and Sonich, help each other at their beauty salon, which is located in their commune. They provide make-up services, hair removal, manicures and pedicures to their customers. The other two children work so they can support their family.

Thy would like to help her daughters financially with the loan she has requested through HKL, so they can purchase supplies needed for their shops such as cosmetics, hair dyes, personal care products, lotions, and other miscellaneous items. Through the help of this loan, Thy hopes that her daughters will be able to improve and strengthen their business. She thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, hair dyes, personal care products, lotions, and other miscellaneous items for her daughters' beauty salon

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es:
Sobeida tiene 44 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora. Está casada y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores y tienen sus familias.
Su trabajo es la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir. Tiene instalado un modesto taller en un espacio de su vivienda. Se dedica básicamente a confeccionar sábanas y fundas de almohadas, pero también elabora camisas o blusas. Se inició comprando una máquina de coser y algunos materiales necesarios para realizar las prendas. Lleva ya casi 20 años en esta actividad y le va bien ya que le genera buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar su creatividad en cada una de las prendas que elabora, le agrada ver la satisfacción de sus clientes al recibir el pedido solicitado. Espera incrementar su producción y continuar trabajando como hasta ahora.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en el crédito anterior. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus miembros son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará todos los materiales que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas de vestir y sábanas.
texts.en:
Sobeida is 44 years old, is a good, friendly and enterprising woman.  She is married and lives in her own house along with her husband and their two children, who are now grown and have their own families.

Her work is the making and repair of articles of clothing.  She has a modest shop in a space within her house.  She is basically dedicated to making sheets and pillowcases, but she also makes shirts and blouses.  She began by buying a sewing machine and some necessary materials to create her articles of clothing.  Now she has worked almost 20 years at this job and is pleased that she can generate good earnings.  What she likes most about this job is that she can express her creativity in each of the articles that she creates, and she is happy to see the satisfaction of her customers upon receipt of the requested order.  She hopes to increase her production and to continue working as she has until now.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support, which makes her feel more secure about advancing with her work.  She promises, one more time, to complete the punctual re-payments of her loan like she did with her previous one.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, where all of the members are very responsible and supportive.

With this loan, 500 sols, she will buy all of the materials she needs to make articles of clothing and sheets.

loans.use: to buy all the materials she needs to make articles of clothing and sheets

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer muy trabajadora,  ella vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, ciudad ubicada al Norte de nuestro país, la cual se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, asimismo se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de plátano, entre otros, asimismo existen atractivos turísticos como "Pakatnamú", "Farfán", "Caracoles", Huaca "Singán”, Templete de Limoncarro, Pampas de Jesús, entre otros. Cuando Karina tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho disfrutar d euno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Karina solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser enfermería.

Con mucha dedicación Karina tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Karina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como cremas, perfumes, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y sobre todo porque podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local grande para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Karina is a very hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Guadalupe in the north of Peru, which is known for the kindness of its people and its agriculture, particularly cultivation of the plantain. There are many tourist attractions near Guadalupe, such as Pakatnamú, Farfán, Caracoles, Huaca Singán, the Temple of Limoncarro, Pampas de Jesús, and more. When Karina has free time she likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pato" [duck with rice]. Karina studied only up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have like to have studied to be a nurse. 

With much dedication, Karina has a small business in the sale of beauty products, like perfumes, creams, makeup, etc. She works around 8 hours a day and can help up to 20 clients a day. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and offers quality products. 

Karina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she can buy more merchandise for her business such as creams, perfumes and more, and with this she will have more variety of products to offer her clients. Because of this she can increase her income and keep fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: "To have a large location for her business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (perfumes, creams, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who will clean her harvests. She will spend almost 400 soles on each parcel. What remains will be used to acquire fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients such as rice, sugar, meats, etc. in order to prepare her foods

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old. She is married to Paul, and together they have two children. She operates a grocery store and has been in this business for the past two years.

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. She will use the loan to purchase more assorted vegetables for her business.

She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted vegetables for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
In a small town in the coastal region of Kenya, we find Ali who is a farmer. He is proud now that his farming has obtained him good results. He is a married man whose beloved wife is Salma, who cares for his four school-going children. Ali has been doing his farming for three years now, selling his farm produce at the market and also from his home.

He tells us that his wife also helps him to sell through door-to-door. His capital has gone down and this is why he turned to Yehu to ask for a loan so as to buy planting materials and fertilizers. He is optimistic that he will have a good harvest this season.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is 25 years old from Nyahururu and is married with no children yet.

Robinson has a milk business that he has been doing for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy milk drums for use in his business.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy milk drums to add to his business.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is 56 years old and married with two children. He is from Unidos, Plaridel. 

To make a living, Leoncio owns and operates a specialized retail store. He has been engaged in his business for six years and earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

Leoncio joined GDMPC in 2010. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mas ropa, ya que estos meses son de mucha demanda por el regreso a clases por lo cual Ella necesita surtirse de ropa mas moderna y de temporada. Pero al no contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio de ropa. 
La señora María podrá incrementar sus ganancias así como también tendrá mas flujo se clientes con lo que podrá aportar mas ingreso a los gastos familiares y podrá apoyar a su esposo en los gastos.
Desea que su negocio crezca y pronto poder ayudar a otras personas económicamente dándoles trabajo en las ventas de ropa.
texts.en:
María is seeking a loan so she can purchase more clothing.  With the school year starting, there is a lot of demand these days, so she needs to stock up on more modern and seasonal clothing, but she does not have enough money to do so.  With the loan, María will be able to increase her profits as well as her flow of clientele so she can contribute more and help her husband out with family expenses.

María would like her business to grow and before long be able to help other people financially by giving them jobs selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 48 años, su pareja es Eduardo, con quien tiene ocho hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 20 y 10 años de edad. Esta familia habita en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.

Ella es agricultora, tiene tres parcelas donde siembra café, plátanos y yuca. La producción de café es rentable por ello debe cultivar durante todo el año. El dinero obtenido le alcanza para abastecer sus gastos diarios, para volver a invertir en otra siembra y para ahorrar. Por otro lado, los plátanos son la clave de su sustento diario porque las cosechas son semanales; y las yucas le sirven primordialmente para el consumo diario de su familia. Con la ayuda de Eduardo y de sus hijos mayores puede optimizar su trabajo y hacerlo más agradable. “Las charlas educativas también nos ayuda mucho”, menciona sobre lo que hacen en su banco comunal.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP y por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuentas. Además muestra agrado e identificación con su banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”. 
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos, ya que la maleza invade con frecuencia sus cafetales impidiendo el crecimiento de sus productos.
texts.en:
Dina is 48 years old. Her partner is Eduardo, with whom she has eight children, whose ages range from 10 to 20 years old. They currently live with only five of them. This family lives in a house of their own, located in an indigenous community of the forested central part of the country. 

Dina is a farmer, and she has three plots of land where she grows coffee, plantains and yuca. Coffee production is profitable, and for that reason she has to cultivate it all year. The money she obtains is sufficient to cover her daily expenses, to invest in the next planting, and to save some. At the same time, the plantains are the key to her daily sustenance, because the harvests are weekly. The yucas are primarily used for her family's daily consumption. With the help of Eduardo and her older children, she is able to optimize her work and make it more pleasant. About her communal bank and its activities, she remarks that "The educational talks also help us a lot." 

This is her eighth loan with MFP, and for her part she is committed to making her payments punctually. She also expresses gratitude and identification with her communal bank, “Flor de San Juan.”
 
She will invest the funds from this loan in paying the laborers whom she will contract to clean up her fields, since harmful weeds frequently invade her coffee plantings, impeding the growth of her crops.

loans.use: to pay the laborers she will contract to clear out harmful weeds that impede the growth of her crops.

loans.name: Diorenda

texts.en:
Diorenda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Diorenda has pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Diorenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 30, is a very hardworking, honest and kind person who is married to Hamisi. Together they have five children who are their source of happiness in their marriage. 

Mwanajuma operates a food stall where she sells basic foodstuffs like rice, flat breads, etc. She has been in this business for the past three years and she counts an infinite number of customers who prefer her dishes because of their quality and affordable prices, and making the situation better, her ever-caring nature to her customers. 

In order to improve her stall, she is asking for a loan so as to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, flavors, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, flavors, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene ya mas de 18 años dedicándose a la venta de comida (como es delicioso menudo y quesadillas) una comida  típica mexicana. Quiere realizar su sueño de tener un negocio con mobiliario y equipo en mejores condiciones para vender más variedad de alimentos y así generar más ingresos para su familia y a las personas que trabajan con ella en el negocio
La señora Yolanda es madre soltera y tiene dos  hijas de edad escolar a quienes les quieren dar un mejor futuro y los estudios necesarios  para que triunfen en la vida.
Solicitan el apoyo a KIVA para realizar este proyecto para crecer  su negocio. 
La señora Yolanda ya han pagar puntual mente  crédito similares para la inversión en su negocio y para la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda has spent over 18 years working in food sales. She sells typical Mexican food, such as delicious, thin quesadillas. She wants to achieve her dream of having a business with furnishings and equipment in better condition to sell a variety of food and generate more profits for her family and those who work with her in the business.

Yolanda is a single mother with two school-age daughters. She wants to give them a better future and the necessary education so they will succeed in life.

She is asking for Kiva's help to complete this project that will grow her business. Yolanda has already been punctual in paying off similar loans to invest in her business and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and equipment

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive junto a su hija María y su nieto Oswaldo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, tiene varios años con el negocio y es muy rentable, es muy conocida en las zonas donde comercia, a los alrededores de la comunidad donde vive, posee ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas etc., todo de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio, Teresa es una mujer luchadora entregada a su labor, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevos retos que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en estos últimos meses la demanda de su producto aumento gracias a su experiencia en las ventas, ahora para aumentar las ganancias quiere invertir de nuevo pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor y perfumes. Teresa tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her daughter Maria and her grandson Oswaldo in her own home.  She works selling clothing and perfumes.  She has worked at this business for several years, is very profitable, and is well known in the commercial zones surrounding the community where she lives.  She has clothing for women, men and children.  The people prefer her because she always has what they need: skirts, dresses, pants, t-shirts, etc., all of the best quality and at accessible prices.  

In addition to offering good service, Teresa is a woman warrior dedicated to her work, always expecting new challenges that allow her to reach success.  In the last few months, the demand for her product has grown thanks to her experience in sales.  Now to increase her earnings, she wants to invest anew, but she doesn't have sufficient capital.  For this reason, she asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing for the elderly and perfumes.  Teresa has a good record of repayment and is very responsible.  She is sure that she can repay the debt and at the same time offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the elderly and perfumes

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Xeabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa es viuda, tiene 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, no tiene hijos, se dedica al cultivo y siembra de flores y a su venta, inicio este negocio con la ayuda de su mamá y hasta el momento lleva 40 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder comprar semilla y así poder sembrar mas flores, para mejorar sus ingresos, también espera tener una granja de pollos. Lo demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, producción de fajas y cortes, cultivo de frutas para la venta, y al cultivo de flores.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 55-year-old widow. She did not have the opportunity to study, and she has no children. She makes a living planting, growing and selling flowers. She began this business with the help of her mother, and thus far has 40 years of experience.

She gets a group together so she can buy seeds and in this way plant more flowers, to improve her income. She also hopes to have a chicken farm. The other group members do craftwork, produce woven belts and clothing articles, grow and sell fruit, and grow flowers.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant flowers

loans.name: Ada Marina

texts.es: Ada Marina de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, todo para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene muchos años de comerciar de forma ambulante y posee mucha experiencia en las ventas que le ayudo a ganar mucha clientela, la conocen en la comunidad donde vive y en todos los alrededores y la gente la prefiere porque el producto que vende es de primera calidad y a precio accesible además que es un excelente servicio; Ada es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, honesta pero sobre todo soñadora, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan obtener un futuro mas prospero y no descansara hasta lograrlo, como toda buena comerciante desea acrecentar el negocio pero o posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Ada Marina tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ada Marina is fifty years old. She lives together with her life partner and their two children. Her work is buying and selling clothing: skirts, pants, dresses --everything for women, men and children. She has been a merchant for many years, selling as a mobile vendor. She has a lot of experience with sales, which has helped her to build a large customer base. She is well known in the community where she lives and in the surrounding area, and people like to buy from her because the products she sells are of the best quality and her prices are affordable. In addition, she offers excellent service. Ada is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work, honest, and above all a dreamer. She is always looking for opportunities which will allow her to have a more prosperous future, and she will not rest until she has achieved this. Like all good merchants, she wants to expand her business, but she does not have sufficient capital; for that reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy clothing on a wholesale basis. Ada Marina has good credit references and is taking responsibility for paying off her debt, while at the same time offering her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Marieta has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. Lorna has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, soap, etc. In the future Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 48 years old and married, with three children. With two children in school, Nimfa works very hard to provide for them.

Nimfa runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries, in her general store.

Nimfa has been in this business for ten years, and she sells a variety of items, such as noodles, egg, spices, sugar, and canned goods. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like shampoo and groceries, to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 50 años, está casada con Fortunato, el padre de sus seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cuatro de ellos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 19 y 9 años. Esta familia habita un hogar sencillo, pero propio que construyeron con el esfuerzo y ganancias de su trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, nació rodeada de los cultivos que sus padres producían, así aprendió esta actividad. Ahora que es una madre y mujer casada tiene 10 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas, pero sólo produce en cuatro. “Siembro tres lotes de café para vender, los plátanos y las yucas es para el consumo de mi familia”, dice. La venta de café es suficiente para mantener su hogar, pues en cada cosecha obtiene 20 sacos, los que vende en la ciudad a los compradores frecuentan el mercado mayorista en los meses de mayo a julio (meses de cosecha). “Este año la venta no estaba tan buena, pero con los plátanos la mayoría de los agricultores salimos adelante”, indica.

Este es su crédito número 9 de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse satisfecha con su banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”, por el trabajo en equipo que realizan.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá contratar dos personas para que realicen la limpieza de sus tres parcelas de café.
texts.en:
Olga is 50 years old. She is married to Fortunato, the father of her six children, but now she only lives with four of them, whose ages range from 19 to 9 years old. This family lives in a simple home, but it is their own that they built from the efforts and earnings of their work.

She works as a farmer. She was born surrounded by the harvests that her parents produced and through this she learned this skill. Now that she is a mother and a married woman she has 10 parcels of agricultural land, but she only produces on four. "I plant three lots of coffee to sell, and bananas and yuca for the consumption of my family" she says. The sale of coffee is sufficient to maintain her home, because with each harvest she obtains 20 sacks, which she sells in the city to the buyers who frequent the wholesale market in the months of May to July (harvest months). "This year the sales were not that good, but with the bananas, the majority of the farmers get ourselves ahead" she indicates. 

This is her 9th loan with MFP. Because of this she gives her word to pay the monthly payments on time. She affirms that she feels satisfied with her community bank, "Flower of San Juan," because of the teamwork they perform. 

With the money from this loan she will hire two people so that they can complete the cleaning of her three parcels of coffee.

loans.use: to hire two people so that they can complete the cleaning of her three parcels of coffee.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose tiene 48 años, pero tiene el espíritu y las ganas de salir adelante como un joven de 20, es padre de 2 hijos de 21 y 7 años, a quienes ama muchísimo y junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para darles una vida digna y sobre todo para que sean mucho mejores que el. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo compartir con su8 familia uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo  “caldo de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, Jose solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor.

Con mucho entusiasmo Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de cómo carpintero, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día, puede atender diariamente hasta 8 clientes,  el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque atiende a los clientes de manera muy amable.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda el podrá comprar madera, laca, barniz, tinner, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo y con ello atender, mejor a sus clientes, así el seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos, y tener una maquina circular para su trabajo”.
texts.en:
Jose is forty-eight but he has the spirit and desire for success of a youth of twenty.  He is the father of two children, a twenty-one- and a seven-year-old, whom he loves very much.  He and he wife work very hard to offer them a decent life, and above all, so they can do better than he has.  When he has free time, he really likes to  listen to music, and most of all he likes to share one of his favorite dishes, super-delicious chicken soup, with his family.   Because of his limited financial resources, Jose was able to go to school only through eleventh grade, but he would like to have studied to be a teacher.  

Jose works very enthusiastically in his carpentry business. He works about twelve hours, and can serve up to eight clients, every day.  He believes the business is doing well because he is very responsible and, most of all, he is very genial to his customers.  

Jose really appreciates the Kiva loans because, thanks to their big help, he'll be able to buy wood, lacquer, varnish, thinner, and other items so he'll have the materials he needs to do his job, serve his clients better, and keep fighting to realize his biggest dreams: provide his children with a good education and to get a circular saw for work.

loans.use: to buy wood, lacquer, varnish, thinner, etc.

loans.name: Lady Marisol

texts.es: Lady Marisol vive junto a sus padres y su hija Karla, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de forma ambulante en los alrededores del mercado de la comunidad donde reside, tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que  buscan a precios accesibles con producto de calidad y un buen servicio; Lady es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a salir adelante siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permiten alcanzar el éxito, pues sabe que cuanto mas trabaje mejor será su recompensa; quiere aumentar sus ventas pero necesita aumentar su inversión y no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Lady Marisol tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable del pago de la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo  tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Lady Marisol vive junto a sus padres y su hija Karla, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de forma ambulante en los alrededores del mercado de la comunidad donde reside, tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que  buscan a precios accesibles con producto de calidad y un buen servicio; Lady es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a salir adelante siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permiten alcanzar el éxito, pues sabe que cuanto mas trabaje mejor será su recompensa; quiere aumentar sus ventas pero necesita aumentar su inversión y no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Lady Marisol tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable del pago de la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo  tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.


Lady Marisol lives with her parents and her daughter, Karla. She travels around the central area of the market in her community to buy and sell clothing. She has several years of experience in this business and it has given her much experience in sales. This has allowed her to gain many customers, who prefer her because she always has what they are looking for at affordable prices. She has good quality products and provides good service. 

Lady is an enterprising woman who is ready to move forward. She is always seeking alternatives that will bring her success. She knows that the more she works, the better she will be compensated. She wants to increase her sales but she needs to increase her investment and she does not have sufficient working capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy wholesale clothing. Lady Marisol has good payment references and is responsible for paying her debt by the established dates. At the same time, she has faith that she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: wholesale clothing

loans.name: Francisca Estela

texts.es: Francisca Estela de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia;  cliente posee un negocio de golosinas y bebidas desde hace ya trece años el tiempo de trabajo le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas y eso le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela fija pues las personas la prefieren porque comercia  productos de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio;  Francisca es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene muchos sueños que desea alcanzar y esta dispuesta trabajar duro para lograrlos, pues sabe que solo así tendrá el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar su negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas por mayor, bebidas, etc. Francisca Estela tiene buenas referencias de pago y muy buena moral asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Francisca Estela is forty-two years old. She lives together with her life partner and their two children in their own house. For thirteen years now, she has operated a business selling sweets and soft drinks. This time spent working has given her a lot of experience in sales, and this allows her to obtain better earnings. She has a lot of steady customers, because people like buying from her, since she sells high quality products at affordable procies, but above all with excellent service. Francisca is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead. She has a lot of dreams she would like to reach, and she is ready to work hard to achieve them, since she knows that this is the only way to have success. Like all good merchants she wants to expand her business, but she needs capital. For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy sweets on a wholesale basis, soft drinks, etc. Francisca Estela has good credit references and a very good moral character. She promises that she will be able to pay off the loan, and at the same time she is confident that she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy sweets on a wholesale basis and beverages.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking mother. She is married to a farmer and together they live at Parog-Parog with their two children. They live simply but happily and are supportive of each other. She raises hogs and manages a small store too. She earns P3,000 each time she disposes of a hog and a minimum of P200 daily from her store. Her income goes for meals, monthly electric bills and the allowance of her younger child who is still in high school. It is just enough for their sustenance and she hopes to increase her revenue to save funds for future expenses of the family. 

Pacita is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs' sustainability. That will help her piglets grow healthier and then she can offer them at higher cost upon maturity. 

In the future, Pacita hopes to achieve a progressive business and give a fortunate life to her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs' sustainability.

loans.name: Succet

texts.en:
Succet is 36 years old, married, and has one child who is currently going to school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Succet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Succet has been raising pigs for 13 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Succet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is 35 years old and divorced, with five children. She runs a small business selling fish at the market. She has been doing this for six months.

Mwanauba has requested a loan to buy more fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She joined Yehu this years to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Mwanauba will use her profits to help her family as best she can.

loans.use: to buy more fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor, a 38-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Having borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF, Eleonor is now requesting one for PHP 20000 to purchase additional stocks to sell in her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Tessie has a small store that sell spices and vegetables. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more spices and vegetables to resell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to resell

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción de cuarenta y seis años de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, y a la venta de productos por catalogo, tiene varios años con su negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad de producto, los excelentes precios pero sobre todo por el buen  servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le ayuden ha llegar al éxito, piensa que si trabaja con perseverancia y motivación no tardara mucho en lograrlo; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda de su producto y como toda buena comerciante planea aprovechar este momento para acrecentar el negocio pero para ello necesita aumentar la inversión y no posee suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, y productos de catalogo. María Concepción tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Concepción, 46, lives with her life partner and their two children in their own house. She makes a living selling pupusas and products by catalog. She has had this business for several years and she has grown a large clientele because people prefer the quality of her products, the excellent prices, and above all the good service. María is an entrepreneurial woman with many goals she wishes to meet. She is always on the lookout for new opportunities to help her achieve success. She thinks that if she works with perseverance and motivation, she will not take long to achieve success.

In recent weeks the demand for her products has risen, and like every good merchant she plans to take advantage of this moment to grow the business, but for that she needs to investment more and she does not have enough capital to support this. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, beans and catalog products. María Concepción has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures us that she will pay her debt off along with giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, fried pork rind, beans and catalog products

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de 39 años de edad, es una persona muy alegre y positiva quien a pesar de las dificultados ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por sus cuatro hijos. María posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos tanto alimenticios como de primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde desde hace 5 años que se dedica a ella. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales posee mayor demanda, así de esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ventas. María  es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y así  brindarle un futuro comprometedor a sus hijos en el cual puedan contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en: María del Carmen, thirty-nine, is a very happy and positive person who, despite difficulties, has managed bring success to her family, which includes four children.  She has a store where she sells basic household food items.  The store is located in her home, where she's been working for five years.  María is seeking a loan to stock up on bread, milk, juices, etc., because they are in high demand and she is hoping to increase sales.  She is a hard-working woman who wants to improve her business so she can have more stability and provide her children a promising future in which they have all they need for a better life.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, and juices to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dolores Gloria

texts.es: Dolores Gloria de  69 años de edad, es una señora muy laboriosa que a pesar de su edad debe trabajar arduamente para salir adelante junto a su nieto menor de edad. Ella posee una tienda donde comercializa productos perecederos como: bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, pan entro otros más, así mismo para obtener ganancias extras ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, un negocio que es de mucha ayuda para ella ya que posee varios clientes quienes de paso al comprar las tortillas compran algún productos de la tienda, su nieto le ayuda a atender ambos negocios. Dolores solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda y adquirir nuevos productos y mayor cantidad de la que ya tiene; así mismo para comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortillas. Dolores ansia mucho salir adelante y mejorar su estabilidad económica pronto.
texts.en:
Dolores Gloria, 69 years old, is a hard-working woman who works arduously to move forward, despite her age. She works with her young grandson. Dolores owns a store, in which she sells perishable goods such as drinks, basic grains, candy, bread, and other products. Also, in order to earn extra income, she makes tortillas. This business is a great help to her because many of the customers who come to buy tortillas also buy some products from the store. Her grandson helps her with both businesses. 

Dolores is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, so she can use the money to invest in the store and acquire new products in larger quantities than she has currently. She will also buy corn for making tortillas. Dolores has much desire to move forward and improve her financial stability soon.

loans.use: to buy perishable goods for her store

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jacquilyn is 34 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Jacquilyn has a  business selling used clothing in the Philippines. Jacquilyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Jacquilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jacquilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, comes from Olkalou, and is married with two children who are aged 22 and seven years old. 

Mary has a dairy business that she has been doing for the past four years and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy another dairy cow. She is optimistic that her dairy business will do better since there will be an increase in milk production.

She hopes to be financially independent and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is from Magsaysay, Baliangao. He is 53 years old and married, with five children. 

To make a living, Dante plants, harvests, and sells bananas. He has been in business for two years and earns PHP 6,000 a month for these activities. This year, Dante joined GDMPC. 

Dante is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is 42 years old and married, and he and his wife are blessed with three school-aged-children.  

Marcelino is engaged in a hog fattening business as a source of income. He has been managing his hog raising business for over two years. 

He is a very patient and industrious father. He operates his livelihood to provide all the needs of his family. It is quite difficult, but his willingness to lift his family from poor living pushes him to execute this work.

Now he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fees, vitamins, and vaccine for his hogs. He wants to develop his hog fattening business more to earn higher proceeds for his children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccine for his hogs

loans.name: Eusebio De Jesus

texts.es: Eusebio, es un señor de 64 años, está casado y tiene 8 hijos, vive solo con su esposa en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. Hace más de 10 años que don Eusebio estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como granos básicos, lácteos, azúcar, productos enlatados, condimentos, etc. además vende repuestos para bicicletas, baterías, pastillas, y otros de abarrotería. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de más productos de granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos y refrescos. El quiere que su negocio se mantenga estable con esta inversión y que aumente las ventas. Su meta es trabajar mucho para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Eusebio is a 64 year-old gentleman who is married and has 8 children.  He lives only with his wife in the municipality of Omoa, in the department of Cortes.  More than 10 years ago, Eusebio started up his own business.  The business is a grocery store where he sells consumer staples such as: grains, dairy products, sugar, canned goods, condiments, etc.  He also sells spare parts for bicycles, batteries, pills and other grocery items.  He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to stock up his store with more staple grains, dairy products, sausages and beverages.  With this investment, he wants to keep his business stable and increase his sales.  Eusebio's goal is to work a lot in order to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, dairy products, sausages, juices and other beverages to stock up his store

loans.name: Siempre Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Siempre Amigas es un banco comunal formado por 18 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la calidez de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil como las socias quienes trabajan diariamente para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y buscan un mejor porvenir para sus familias, se dedican a los trabajos del campo como la agricultura y cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes puestos de trabajo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen Lucia, tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de  un hijo de 4 años de edad  que este año ingresa a estudiar a una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su abuelita a quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y le hace compañía.
 
La Señora Carmen Lucia de es una profesional en la rama de la costura, tiene un pequeño taller hace 4 años en donde se dedica a elaborar polleras (vestidos típicos) y blusas. También cría animales en especial ganado.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra de telas e hilos para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
"Always Friends" is a communal bank formed by 18 women who live near the parish of Valle en Cuenca, a place that has beautiful countryside in which one can enjoy the warmth and beauty of nature.  The people of Valle de Cuenca are friendly and gentle, like the members of the community bank, who work daily to better the economies of their homes and seek a better future for their families.  They work at jobs of the countryside like agriculture and the raising of animals commercially.  Many also work in the city at various different kinds of jobs.

One of the members of this group is Carmen Lucia.  She is 35 years old and is the single mother of one 4 year old son, who this year will begin to study in a small school in the city.  She doesn't have her own house so she lives in her grandmother's house, who helps her with the household costs and gives her company.

Carmen Lucia is a professional dressmaker.  She has had a small shop for the last 4 years where she makes "polleras" (typical dresses of the region) and blouses.  She also raises livestock, especially cattle.

Her new loan will be used for the purchase of cloth and thread for her business.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual elabora tortillas, realizándolas  de lunes a domingo, ya que posee muchos clientes a los cuales es necesario atenderlos lo mejor posible. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde vende con la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de los alrededores. Antonia  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Este negocio es muy importante para Antonia  ya que le permite crecer como persona, debido a que puede contar con su propio trabajo y de esta misma forma ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo a contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
Antonia lives with her husband and two children who help her with the business. She has her own business in which she makes tortillas, making them from Monday to Sunday since she has many clients and it is necessary to attend to them in the best possible way. The business is located in a room of her house where she sells to the majority of her neighbors and the people from nearby. 

Antonia is requesting a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of raw material to make her tortillas. This business is very important to Antonia since it allows her to grow as a person due to the fact that she can rely on her own work, and by working can help her family to have better economic stability and likewise have everything necessary for the home.

loans.use: to buy corn in order to make tortillas

loans.name: Eda Marili

texts.es: Eda Marili vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora la cual se dedica de lleno a su negocio para brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Desde hace cinco años ella posee una sala de belleza en donde trabaja a mujeres niños y hombres haciendo cortes de cabello, tintes, manicuras y más, así mismo comercializa productos de belleza y joyería con baños de oro o de plata. Eda cuenta con varios clientes ya que ha logrado ganar la confianza de sus vecinos y amigos quienes saben que siempre realiza el mejor trabajo posible. Eda solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, joyería y tintes en diferentes marcas y variedad, de esta forma podrá ampliar su negocio y contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Eda Marili lives together with her husband and two minor children. She is a very hard-working person who dedicates herself fully to her business, in order to provide the best for her family. For the past five years, she has operated a beauty salon where she works on women, children and men, providing haircuts, coloring, manicures and more. At the same time, she sells beauty products and jewelry plated with silver or gold. Eda has numerous customers, since she has been able to win the confidence of her neighbors and friends, who know that she always does the best work possible. Eda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with the desire to be able to buy a larger quantity of beauty products, jewelry and hair dyes of various brands and types. In this way she will be able to expand her business and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Santa cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a las actividades de agricultura, en su parcela cultiva hortalizas, como culantro, pataste, zanahoria, rábano etc. ella ha sido cliente de ODEF, quien ha solicitado 10 prestamos anteriormente con los cuales ha mantenido en pie sus cultivos. Actualmente solicita otro de 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va a fertilizar los cultivos y va preparar parcelas para nueva siembra, ampliando así su cultivo principalmente el de culantro. Su meta es seguir trabajando para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 38, is married and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa in the department of Cortes.

Maria has been farming for 10 years; on her land, she cultivates vegetables such as cilantro, chayote, carrots, and radishes.  She has been a client of ODEF who has requesting 10 loans previously.  She has used those loans to keep going with her farming activities.  She is now requesting another loan, of 25,000 Honduran lempiras, that she will use to fertilize her crops and prepare parcels of land for a new planting.  This way she can expand her main crop, which is cilantro. 

 Maria's goal is to continue to work so that she can provide a higher standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to fertilize her vegetable crops and prepare land to cultivate

loans.name: Mujeres Floreciendo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Floreciendo es un banco comunal que está formado por 13 socias, ellas son amigas, vecinas y conocidas que tienen algo en común que es salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias a superarse, son trabajadoras, luchadoras y a pesar de las  adversidades de la vida siempre están mirando hacia delante con una sonrisa. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene clima frió, su geografía accidentada le regala hermosos paisajes, su arquitectura que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su cultura y tradiciones son admiradas por sus visitantes y es un orgullo para su gente.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Luz, tiene 45 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 23 años que está en la universidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es la recompensa a su arduo trabajo en matrimonio.
 
Doña Luz es dueña de una volqueta y se dedica al trasporte pesado desde hace 8 años, para esto tiene un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo mensual. En casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos y también se dedica a la agricultura, sus cosechas son para la venta y el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su crédito ahora lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y cerdos para seguir creciendo en esta actividad.
 
Su sueño es viajar a diferentes partes del mundo que le gustaría conocer.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Floreciendo" [Women in Bloom] is a communal bank that is made up of 13 members. They are friends, neighbors, and acquaintances who have something in common: making a living and helping their families to improve themselves. They are hardworking, determined, and despite the adversity in their lives, they always look to the future with a smile. 

They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather, and its rugged geography offers beautiful scenery. Its architecture is a mixture of colonial and modern, and its culture and traditions are admired by its visitors and a source of pride for its people.

Luz is one of the members of the group. She is 45 years old and married. She and her husband have one 23-year-old son who is at the university. Her husband works in the construction field as a bricklayer. The house they live in is the reward for their hard work as a couple.

Luz is the owner of a dump truck and she has worked in heavy transport for eight years. For this, she has a driver to whom she pays a monthly salary. At home, she works at raising guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and she also does agricultural work; her harvests are for sale as well as household consumption.

She will now invest this loan in the purchase of livestock feed and pigs, so she can continue developing this business.
 
Her dream is to travel to different parts of the world that she would like to visit.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and pigs.

loans.name: Rene Armando

texts.es: Rene Armando de veintitrés años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija; él se dedica a la venta de tortillas con ayuda de su esposa, tiene varios años con el negocio y  eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Rene es un hombre dedicado a su labor, honesto, responsable y soñador, esta dispuesto a ganarse un futuro mejor, en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda de su producto y como todo buen comerciante quiere acrecentar la tortilleria pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Rene Armando tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene confianza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rene Armando is twenty-three years old and lives with his wife and daughter.  He sells tortillas with the help of his spouse.  He has worked in this business for several years and has been rewarded with lots of experience in sales.  The business is run out of his home and he has many customers.  People prefer him for the quality and good prices of his tortillas, but above all for his excellent service.

Rene is a man dedicated to his work.  He is honest, responsible, and a dreamer.  He is willing to earn a better future.  In the last few months, the demand for his product has increased, and like all good businessmen, he wants to expand his tortilla business but needs the capital.  For this reason, he is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL that will permit him to purchase wholesale corn.  Rene Armando has a good record of repayment.  He is sure that he can repay this debt, and at the same time, he has confidence that he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina  de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de uso personal, blusas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, cremas, perfumes, todo para dama, caballeros y niños, comercia de forma ambulante y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, además tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Rosalina es una mujer activa, entregada a su labor, esta siempre a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presenten pues sabe que esas le abrirán puertas al éxito, una de sus grades metas es acrecentar su negocio pero necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Rosalina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 51, lives with her family and works as a street vendor selling clothing and personal care products: blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, creams, perfumes, and women's, men's and children's accessories.  She has acquired much experience in sales and attracted many customers, since people prefer to buy from her when they need a top quality item, at a low price and with good customer service.  

Rosalina is very active and dedicated to her job; and she is always on the alert for new opportunities to help her be successful.  One of her greatest goals is to grow her business, but she needs working capital and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy wholesale clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.  Rosalina has a good credit record and very high values, and is committed to paying back her loan while providing a full life for her family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Alicia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy showcases, shelves and materials to construct a kiosk.

loans.name: Rosalva Elizabeth

texts.es: Rosalva Elizabeth de 29 años de edad, es una persona soltera y sin hijos, quien trabaja para salir adelante y superarse cada vez más para ser mejor. Ella posee un salón de belleza en el cual trabaja desde hace tres años, tiempo en el cual se ha esforzado por equipar con todo lo necesario su negocio, siendo en la actualidad aún una necesidad ya que las tendencias de bellas van cambiando constantemente. Rosalva solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más espejos, sillas, pelucas, tintes, cremas y todo lo necesario para realizar su trabajo y así mismo para comercializar con sus clientes. Ella tiene muchas esperanzas de mejorar sus ingresos y así vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Rosalva Elizabeth, 29, is single, with no children, and works to get ahead and improve her lifestyle.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years, during which time she has worked hard to equip her business with everything she needs, although it is something she must stay on top of because of the constantly changing trends of the beauty world.

Rosalva is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy mirrors, chairs, hair pieces, hair color, cream and everything she needs to do her work and sell products to customers.  She is very hopeful of improving her income and leading a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy chairs, hair pieces and hair color for her business.

loans.name: Concepción Luz

texts.es: Concepción Luz  de 18 años de edad, es una joven humilde pero trabajadora quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos ya que se esfuerza para salir adelante, ya que únicamente vive junto a su abuela y dos hermanos junto a quienes trabaja para contar con todo lo necesario. Concepción se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas las cuales comercializa de forma ambúlate en colonias aledañas a su vivienda, así mismo le ayuda a su abuela a elaborar tortillas para posteriormente venderlas. Concepción solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la intención de poseer el dinero necesario para comprar más verduras y atender todos los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, así mismo para comprar leña y maíz para el negocio de las tortillas. Con esto Concepción espera aumentar sus ganancias para poder vivir mejor junto a su abuela quien también ha luchado mucho por sus nietos, lo que Concepción espera compensárselo mejorando los ingresos actuales.
texts.en:
Concepcion Luz, 18, is a humble and hardworking youth who has good references from her neighbors, because she works hard to get ahead.  She lives only with her grandmother and her two siblings, and they work together so that they will have everything they need.

Concepcion has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She sells from place to place in the neighborhoods surrounding her house.  In addition, she helps her grandmother to make tortillas to later sell.  Concepcion is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can have enough money to buy more vegetables to fill all of her customer's orders.  She will also buy firewood and corn for her tortilla business.  With this investment, Concepcion hopes to increase her earnings so that she can live better along with her grandmother.  Concepcion's grandmother fought hard to provide for her grandchildren, and she would like to pay her back by improving her current income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia Patricia de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Néstor y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos camarones, conchas y pescado por la mañana y pupusas por la tarde, tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y se hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo el producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Silvia es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica,  luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sabe que solo con perseverancia y motivación alcanzara el éxito que desea, como toda buena comerciante desea aumentar sus ganancias pero para eso necesita aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos por mayor, maíz, quesillo, frijol, chicharrón, etc. Silvia Patricia tiene buenas referencias de pago, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Silvia Patricia is 33 years old and lives with her life partner, Nestor, and their two children. She runs a business selling shrimp, shellfish and fish during the mornings and dumplings in the afternoons. She has been running her business for a few years and she has many customers because people know that her products are high-quality and that she offers excellent service. Silvia is dedicated to her work, she is energetic, hard-working and wants to get ahead in life. She knows that she will only achieve success if she perseveres and stays motivated. Like all good business people, she wants to increase her earnings but, to do so, she needs to increase her level of investment; consequently, she is applying to INTEGRAl for a loan, which will allow her to buy wholesale seafood, corn, cheese, beans and pork, etc. Silvia Patricia has good credit references and takes a responsible attitude towards paying off her debt, and at the same time she has faith that she will be able to bring economic security to her family home.

loans.use: to buy wholesale seafood, corn, cheese, beans and pork.

loans.name: Grupo Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Grupo Unidas esta compuesto por 16 integrantes mujeres que viven en la misma comunidad. El comité ya tiene mucha de experiencia con el  trabajo grupal, ya que son años los que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo, a resolver sus indiferencias etc.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Lilian es casada y tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella. Lilian se dedica a la venta de ropas para mujeres y niños y con los ingresos que ella obtiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos del hogar. 
Con el crédito pedido, la señora desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, camisas, etc para luego volver a venderlas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Grupo Unidas" ("United Group") is made up of 16 female members who live in the same community.  The committee has lots of experience with group work and has worked together for years.  They meet every week to share, communicate and learn about the news of other members of their group, to resolve their differences, etc.

One of the members, Lilian, is married and has two children that live with her.  Lilian sells clothing for women and children.  With the income she obtains, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

With this loan, Lilian wants to buy a greater quantity of merchandise like knit shirts, pants, t-shirts, etc. which she will later sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like knit shirts, skirts, t-shirts and pants

loans.name: Atanga Joana

texts.en:
She is a widow with five children, and they live in a four-room house in Mbengwi, Momo Division, Northwest Region, Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in life, which include the death of one parent, sickness of her children, and poverty as a widow after the death of her husband, and also constant accusation from her in-laws that she killed her husband.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2002 and has taken and successfully repaid her empowerment credit seven times. She is very hardworking and involved in farming and as such cultivates yams, beans, corn, and a variety of vegetables. 

She promises that, if given the new loan requested, she will buy good seedlings, pay people to clear the farm land, buy fertilizers, and pay people for weeding of the farm. 

She holds a positive view that her business will succeed because there is high demand where she lives. The crops cultivated will serve the community as food, and because she keeps animals, the manure will be used for fertilizing the farm and as such she will have good yields. She will also sell to her friend, who will resell in the Bamenda food market. From this business, the community will benefit from low-price, high-quality farm produce and availability at all times.

She promises that the profit from the loan will be used for family medication and to buy other commodities which she cannot produce; also payment of her children’s school fees and purchase of books. She says a GHAPE loan is preferable because of low interest rates, the repayment of the loan in installments, and education on management before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase labour, manure, seedlings (yams, beans, corn, and a variety of vegetables), and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justina Lum

texts.en:
She is married with three children and they live in a two-room house in Mbengwi, Momo Division, Northwest Region, Cameroon.  She has faced challenges in life such as poverty in her family, death of her loved ones, sickness of family members, and an accident that left her child seriously sick with pain and injuries.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2005 and has taken and successfully repaid her loans four times. Her life has been a success story since she joined GHAPE because her standard of living has been raised. 

She is a hardworking farmer involved in the cultivation of cassava, beans, and maize. She says if given the new loan requested, she will expand her business and improve her yields by paying people to clear her farmlands, buy improved farm seedlings, and also buy fertilizers. She holds a positive view her business will succeed, since she has experience in the field due to longevity. She will put good fertilizer on the crops and also plant good improved farm seedlings.

She promises to expand her business with the profit, educate her children, provide medication for the family, and also buy pigs as to diversify her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because the members are educated before loan disbursement, repayments are made at convenient intervals, and no collateral is needed before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, labour, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Elsa Raquel

texts.es: Elsa Raquel de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien posee una panadería y trabaja haciendo viajes en su pick up; así también vive junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Elsa trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos de primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Elsa desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que de esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, de esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para Elsa su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja de poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a sus hijos a las cuales al mismo tiempo les puede brindar todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Elsa Raquel, 34, lives with her husband who has a bakery and also works using his pick-up truck for transportation.  They live with their two minor children.  Elsa has her own business, which is a store where she sells essential daily items such as bread, water, propane gas, medicines and some sweets.  Her store is in a room of her house.  Elsa wants to offer a wide variety of products at her store so she can sell more and earn a higher profit.  Therefore she is requesting a loan so she can buy the products the customers are looking for.  This will improve her customer service and attract more business.

Elsa's store is very important to her because it allows her to stay at home and do her housework while being close to her children and providing them with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
