EL socio Roberto pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO,el socio continua trabajando como maestro constructor ,el trabaja realizando viviendas,carreteras,colegios de acuerdo a las obras que soliciten sus servicios,el socio lleva años en este trabajo el cual mediante este el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo asi que el socio desea seguir trabajando para brindar lo mejor a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para pagar un terreno que adquirio hace poco.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete acumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Roberto belongs to the communal bank VALLECITO. He continues working as a master builder, building houses, roads and schools according to the work requested by his services. He has been working many years in this business which allows him to get his family ahead. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He hopes to continue working to provide the best for his family. 

Roberto is asking for this loan to pay for a plot of land that he has recently purchased.

He is grateful for this loan granted and promises to fulfill his monthly payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to pay for the plot of land that he has recently purchased.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia Lidia pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO ,la socia continua con su negocio de carpinteria,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia elabora camas,armarios,veladores entre otros,la socia vende de forma independiente a pedido de sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez vende en las ferias de los fines de semana en un mercado local,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que ella saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de madera al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Lidia, belongs to the communal bank VALLECITO. She still has a carpentry business, she has been running this business for years and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in everyday.

The member makes beds, wardrobes, candle holders and others. She sells them independently according to client orders, she also sells them at local markets on the weekends. The member is a responsible and hard working person, using this work to help her family succeed.

The member is asking for this loan to buy wholesale wood.

The member is grateful for the offered loan and committed to repaying it according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood.

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
Pet, aged 47 years, is married and has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and in school. She lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district’s Pursat province in Cambodia. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice on 2 hectares of farmland for more than 20 years and work as paid workers to complement the family’s income. The current business earns them about 13,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and allows them to save about KHR 4,000 each day after offsetting their daily expenses. However, drought is the main challenge for her field business.

Pet’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is in her fourth microloan with VisionFund. The past three loans have helped her better support her family. Now, she is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her income from the rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга занимается мелким предпринимательством в сфере торговли. Она торгует недорогой женской одеждой на центральном рынке города. Торговая точка находится у нее в собственности. Опыт работы составляет 8 лет. 
Ольга надеется вложить предложенные КИВОЙ средства в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку сезонной женской одежды, а именно юбок, брюк, кофт и халатов. За счет полученной от торговли прибыли Ольга хочет улучшать условия семейного быта.
texts.en:
Olga has a small business selling inexpensive women's clothing at the central city market. She owns her clothing stall and has 8 years of work experience. 

Olga hopes to invest the proposed 10,000 griven loan from Kiva to purchase seasonal women's clothing, specifically, skirts, pants, jackets, and robes. She wants to use the profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijas; ella posee una tortillería en el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las tortillas que comercia son calientitas y elaboradas con material de primera calidad además de los buenos precios y el servicio mas rápido; Teresa es una mujer activa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja muy duro día con día para alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas tuvo algunas perdidas pero desea recuperarse, quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, etc. Teresa tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo le ofrecerá a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teresa is 59 years old and lives together with her two daughters. She owns a tortilla shop located in her home. She has spent several years on this business and this has given her lots of experience in sales. She is very well known in the area and now she has many customers because the tortillas that she sells are warm, are made with top quality materials, are well priced and her service is the fastest. Teresa is a very active woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She works very hard every day to achieve success. En the last few weeks she had a few losses but she seeks to recover and she wants to complete a new investment. Because of this, she sought a loan from Integral that will permit her to buy mainly corn and wood, etc. Teresa has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures that she will discharge the debt in the established period and at the same time it will offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase mainly corn, and wood.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 50 years old. She is a single lady and is blessed with four children. She does mixed farming and also buys avocados from other farmers at a wholesale price and then sells them in an open-air market. She has done so for the last seven years with the monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first business loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy more stock of avocados from the farmers for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to support and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to buy avocados to sell.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi tiene 27 años, vive con su madre y su hermana en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años.  
Ella estudió psicología, en la actualidad trabaja como asesora familiar en un albergue de su localidad. Gusta mucho de su trabajo, pues comparte muchas cosas con sus colegas y con los niños a los que ayuda. Pasa la mayor parte del día en su trabajo, ahí comenzó hace algunos años a vender ropa y productos de belleza a sus colegas; “hacen sus pedidos y me pagan la mitad, cuando entrego la prenda me pagan lo restante”, comenta. En estos meses tiene más pedidos, por lo que la falta el capital de trabajo para continuar, es así que acude a MFP.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que le dan, prometiendo cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Heidi invertirá este dinero en la compra de ropa y cosméticos, en grandes cantidades, para abastecer a su clientela.
texts.en: Heidi is twenty-seven, lives with her mother and her sister in a house they have been renting for two years. She studied psychology and now works as a family counselor in a shelter in her town. She likes her work very much, because she shares a lot with her colleagues and the children she helps. She spends the majority of her time at work. She started selling clothes and beauty products to her colleagues a few years ago. She says they pay half upon ordering and the other half when they receive the product. The number of orders has been growing, but she lacks the capital to meet them, and that is why she approached field partner MFP. This is her second loan with MFP; she feels more certain about the future with the field partner's backing. She thanks everyone in her group for the trust they place in her, and promises to make her repayments on time, because she does not want to abuse her group's confidence, since all the members are united and responsible. Heidi will use this money to buy clothes and cosmetics in great quantities in order to meet her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics in great quantities in order to meet her customers' orders.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano  tiene 35 años de edad está casado hace 15 años, tienen 4 hijos juntos.
El señor Feliciano es  muy trabajador, se dedica a la pulida de pisos desde hace 10 años, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido comprar la maquinaria para poder realizar su trabajo de forma eficiente y rápido. También cuenta con otro negocio que es una despensa  en su domicilio.
El crédito solicitado sería para la compra de productos necesarios para su trabajo como detergentes, soda caustica, ceras etc que le harán posible seguir garantizando la calidad de su servicio. Asimismo, en otra etapa desea comprar maquinarias para poder progresar cada día mas.
texts.en: Feliciano is 35, has been married for 15 years, and has 4 children with his wife. Feliciano is a hard worker and has polished floors for 10 years. With a lot of hard work and sacrifice, he was able to purchase the machinery necessary to do his work quickly and efficiently. He also has another business, which is a grocery store in his home. The loan he is requesting is to purchase the necessary products for his work, such as detergent, caustic soda, waxes, etc, that will make it possible for him to continue guaranteeing the quality of his service. Additionally, in another stage, he’d like to purchase machinery to be able to progress more and more each day.

loans.use: purchase floor polishing supplies including detergents, caustic soda, and waxes

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in the Moung Russey district’s Battambang province in Cambodia, Vorn is 37 years old. She is married with two dependent children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are still in school. To support the family, she has been involved in rice farming and hairdressing for four years, while her husband works as a paid construction worker to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 18,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and allows her to save about KHR 10,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Vorn’s group consists of three members who are all females who live in the same village. This is the fifth loan for her with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to seek a new loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs to plow her farmland. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy more hairdressing materials. Vorn hopes to increase her income from the current business to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and plow her farmland.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano" esta compuesto por 11 integrantes, el grupo empezó demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras quienes ya cuentan con sus actividades productivas propias.Las  integrantes han demostrado mucho interes por el programa ya que con un trabajo digno por mas pequeña que parezca ser ellas demuestran que pueden cumplir con sus metas.
Una de las integrantes la señora Felicia se encarga de la cría de animales. Ella es la encargada de alimentar a los animales con alimentos balanceados, de pasearlos y luego meterlos en los corrales para que descansen. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mejor calidad de alimentos balanceados para dar a los animales.
texts.en:
The "San Cayetano" communal bank is made up of 11 members, the group started to show solidarity and unity between the members who all have their own productive businesses. 

The members have shown a lot of interest in the programme and decent work, since, as small as it seems to be, they are showing that they can achieve their goals.

One of the members, Felicia raises livestock. She feeds the animals with balanced feed, walks them and then puts them in the enclosures to rest.

The loan that she requested would be to buy better quality feed to give the animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province in Cambodia, Sokha is a 32-year-old married mother of two sons, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To sustain the family’s needs, she has been sowing mushrooms for two years. 

Sokha has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Her fellow group member is just in the first loan cycle as a client with VisionFund. Sokha used the past loan to better support her mushroom business. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to build a shelter for seeding the mushrooms. She hopes to increase her income from the current business to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To build a shelter for seeding the mushrooms.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is aged 41 years and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. She has two children. To support the family, she has been growing cabbages for 20 years and supplementing the family’s income by selling vegetables such as cabbages, eggplants, carrots, etc. Lack of working capital to support her current business is still the main challenge.

Ny’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and this is the third loan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past two loans have supported her family with sufficient food. Now, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for planting her cabbages, and she will use a portion of loan to buy more vegetables for selling. She hopes to increase her income from the current business to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting her cabbages.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio, estaba casado pero hace más de tres años se separó de su esposa , tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta la primaria pero pudo aprender el oficio de sastre  y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la confección de chamarras, trabajando por más de diez horas al día para posteriormente venderlas de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material, tela, forro, cierres,  etc., para la confección de sus productos ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos por que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Eustaquio, es ampliar su taller y tener un puesto de venta fijo ya que vender de forma ambulante es muy sacrificado.
Es la décima segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eustaquio is married, but he separated from his wife three years ago.  He has two children who are now independent.  He lives in his own house, occupying only one room with brick walls and a dirt floor.  The house is in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz.

He only has an elementary school education, but he was able to learn the occupation of being a tailor.  He now gets income from making jackets.  He works for over ten hours a day in order to later sell them.  He sells in an itinerant manner because he does not have a fixed stand.

The loan that he needs is to buy materials like fabric, lining, and zippers, etc. to make his products.  He wishes to improve his income because he needs to cover the food expenses and pay for basic services.

Eustaquio’s dream is to expand his workshop and to have a fixed sales stand.  This is because selling in an itinerant manner is very hard work.

This is the 12th time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy  fabric, lining, zippers, and other supplies for his business of making jackets.

loans.name: Gs La Estrella Group

texts.es:
Doña Carmenza es un señora muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, madre de tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y le ayudan en sus negocios. Tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a Lo que es la venta de golosinas.
Doña Carmenza El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, condimentos, carnes y otros, Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir.  Ya que ella también da crédito a sus clientes.
Doña Carmenza sus sueños son de poder darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad. 
Maribel se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace mas de 4 años y actualmente vive con su esposo.
Surit se dedica a su negocio propio venta de ropa usada desde hace más de 8 años.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Carmenza is a very hard working and dedicated woman and mother of 3 young children who help in her work. 

She has a business at her home in the south of Honduras. For more than 10 years she is sold snacks.

The loan that she needs is for buying drinks, condiments, meats and other things, the loan will help her as she will have fresh capital to invest as she also sells on credit to her customers.

Her dream is to give her children a quality education.

Maribel has sold used clothes for over four years and lives with her husband.

Surit has sold used clothes for over 8 years.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, meats, etc. for their business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Edjiwengatuwa Ii Group

texts.es:
El comité Edijiwengatuwa II esta conformado por cinco mujeres menores de edad de la comunidad indígena Ache. Estas jóvenes al ser menores de edad son sus padres los que figuran como co-deudores, de igual forma este trabajo se realiza en forma conjunta ya que sus familias realizan respectivos trabajos en la agricultura, crías de animales, entre otras actividades. Las integrantes del comité se encuentran muy satisfechas con el programa ya que han podido crear sus propios trabajos y generar un poco más de dinero para sus hogares.
Una de las integrantes Luisa se encarga de la cría de animales. Ella se encarga de alimentarlo con la mejor calidad disponible y accesible para ellos, también ella debe pasearlos, volver a meterlos en los establos, etc. 
El crédito solicitado para ella y para todas las mujeres han sido invertidos para aumentar sus actividades actuales y futuras.
texts.en:
The Committee Edijiwengatuwa II is made up of five minor women in the indigenous community of Ache.  These young women, since they are minors, have their parents as co-borowers and this work is also done together so that their families can complete their respective work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and other activities.  The members of the committee are very satisfied with the program since them have been able to create their own jobs and generate a little more money for their homes.

One of the members, Luisa, is in charge of raising animals.  She feeds them with the best food possible and available to them.  She also takes them out and returns them to the stables, etc.

The loan requested for her and for all the women will be invested in their present and future activities.

loans.use: to buy balanced foods.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – рыночный предприниматель. Она уже около 14 лет работает на базаре, реализуя женскую одежду. За годы работы в этом секторе она смогла выкупить торговое место, что помогает ей существенно экономить на аренде на данном этапе. Самые продаваемые из ее группы это блузы, кофты, свитера. 
Ольге необходима дополнительная сумма в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную женскую одежду на осень-зиму. Ольге – 50 лет. Она не всегда может надеяться на получение кредита в местных кредитных учреждениях, так как там неохотно дают кредиты людям предпенсионного возраста. Поэтому кредиты КИВА стали настоящим решением проблемы для Ольги и однозначно находкой для развития ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Olga is a 50-year-old entrepreneur who has worked for 14 years selling women's clothing at a market. After years of work in this sector, she was able to buy a market stall, which significantly helps her save money on rent at the moment. Her best selling items are blouses, jackets, and sweaters. 

Olga needs an additional 10,000 griven in order to purchase women's fall and winter clothing. She cannot always count on getting a loan from local loan institutions because they are reluctant to give loans to people approaching retirement age. Therefore, a Kiva loan is a real solution for Olga's problem and naturally, a godsend for the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing for fall and winter

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es: Erika Yamileth de veintitrés años de edad vive junto  a su compañero de vida Felipe y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener el máximo de ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque saben que su producto es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Erika es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada su labor y a su familia, tiene muchas metas que desea alcanzar y siempre esta en la búsqueda de oportunidades que le abran paso a cumplir sus sueños, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda de los productos y desea aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Erika Yamileth tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erika Yamileth is twenty-three years old. She lives with her partner Felipe and their son in their own house. She has a shop where she sells basic items such as rice, broad beans, milk, eggs, and bread. She has been tending to this shop for many years, and her vast experience enables her to have a very good income. The shop is located in her house. She has a lot of customers because people know that she sells quality products at affordable prices, and, above all, that the service is excellent. Erika is very hardworking and motivated, dedicated to both her work and her family. She has many goals she wishes to reach and is always on the lookout for opportunities that can help her accomplish her dreams. In the last few months, demand for her products has risen, and she wishes to take advantage of that to sell more. That is why she asks field partner INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant food, drinks, soap, etc. Erika has a very good credit history and strong morals. She guarantees that she will be able to repay her loan and she knows she will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio Fernando sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco, Perú. 

El socio Fernando tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa  relación tiene 2 hijos,  el socio Fernando sigue con el negocio de la venta de útiles de escritorio librería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores y otras cosas más.  

El socio Fernando solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio como cuadernos, papeles,  lapiceros, plumones y entre otros.  El socio Fernando agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fernando is still a member of the communal bank “Mi Perú” [My Peru] in the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru.

Fernando is 50 years old. He is married, and his wonderful marriage has produced two children. Fernando continues to run his business selling office supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other items.

Fernando is requesting this loan to supply his business with notebooks, paper, pencils, pens, and other items. Fernando is grateful to everyone who has contributed to his dream through this site. He is committed to make his loan payments on time.

loans.use: sell office supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other items.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina de 56 años de edad, es madre soltera no tiene dependientes, vive con su madre que ya esta bastante mayor, su casa esta ubicada en la cuidad de Nacaome, en la parte sur de Honduras, en donde todo los días sale al mercado y a lugares aledaños a vender sus productos plásticos, ropa y calzado en el mercado de Nacaome.
Doña Marcelina esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de zapato y ropa interior. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella invertirá más en su negocio y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Doña Marcelina su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio y también mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 56, is a single mother with no dependents.  She lives with her elderly mother.  Her house is in the city of Nacaome in the southern part of Honduras.  Every day she goes to the Nacaome market and surrounding areas to sell plastic products, clothes and shoes.

Marcelina is requesting 10,000 lempiras to buy shoes and underwear.  With the support of the loan she will invest more in her business, and she will have better income.

Marcelina’s dream is to continue working and improving her business.  She also dreams of improving her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy shoes and underwear for her business.

loans.name: Gladys Nah

texts.en:
She is a widow with two children and they live in a two-room house in Ngyen-Mbo, a quarter in Momo Division, Bamenda. She has faced many challenges in life, which include the death of her husband, leaving her alone to take care of the children’s medication, education, and also to provide them with other necessities of life.

She joined GHAPE early this year with encouragement from members who felt the same as her before joining the organization. She says being in the organization has empowered her financially, materially, and spiritually. 

With the loan requested, she promises to expand her vegetable farm because she is involved with the cultivation of vegetables of all kinds like hunky berry, carrots, cabbage, and sweet herbs. 

She says the community will benefit from the intake of a balanced diet and above all, the low prices. She holds a strong view her business will succeed because of longevity in the business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings, fertilizer, and medicine.

loans.name: Bikram

texts.en:
Bikram is a 48-year-old physically-challenged person living with his wife and two sons, ages  25 and 20 years old. He runs a variety shop where he sells betel, tobacco sachets, biscuits, toffees, tomatoes, potatos, detergents, soaps, shampoo sachets, snacks, etc. He earns 8,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. One of his son works as a laborer in his village and the younger one is pursuing his graduation. 

Bikram wants to repair his shop and purchase more stock of what he sells to increase his inventory. He would also like to add new products like cell phone talk value recharge vouchers and soft drinks. He has requested a loan of 50,000 INR to purchase recharge vouchers, a refrigerator for keeping soft drinks, and more stock. He wants his younger son to study more and get admitted to a good college and work in a public sector unit. He wants his elder son to help him run the shop and make it much bigger.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing recharge vouchers, a refrigerator for keeping soft drinks, betel, tobacco sachets, biscuits, toffees, tomato, potato, detergents, soaps, etc., for his variety store.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a villager from a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng District of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is age 33 and married with five children, two daughters and three sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been in a tailoring business for 10 years, while her husband is a paid construction worker generating extra income for the family. Their current business earns them about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day and they manage to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sok’s group consists of five members and this is the first loan for her with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She and the other members are now applying for a loan with VisionFund of 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine such as a latrine bowl, sewage and tile draining, etc. She hopes this loan will help her family have a healthy latrine for use.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en: Qusai owns a blacksmith workshop that he wants to renew. He has applied for this loan to buy new equipment for the shop to make his job easier. This workshop is the source of income he uses to support his family of six members.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a married man who has three school-going children. He has been selling fish at the market for the past five years, selling from his small store. Kassim counts a very large number of customers who come to buy raw fish. He has rented the place where he sells his fish, though he has his own refrigerator to preserve fish. His aim is to have his own area and have a fish depot. 

Kassim is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of fish for resale. He gets his supplies from fishmongers, some of whom he knows very well and, therefore, he can have his stock on credit.

loans.use: to add stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 56 years old; she is married to Gilbert, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Catherine will use the loan to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, maize flour and wheat flour for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to support and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, maize flour and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Nidia Yolanda

texts.es: Nidia Yolanda vive junto a su compañero de vida Héctor y su hijo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de medicina natural,  tiene  varios años de trabajar en el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite a la vez obtener muy buenas ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues las personas confían en la calidad del producto, y están satisfechos con los buenos precios y el servicio inigualable pues Nidia siempre esta a la orden de las personas que la visitan; es una mujer activa, entregada a su labor, y muy luchadora siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, últimamente ha tenido mas demanda y como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicina por mayor. Nidia Yolanda tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a al mismo tiempo tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nidia Yolanda lives with her partner Héctor and their son. She buys and sells natural medicines. She has been in this trade for many years and thus is a very experienced seller, a fact which enables her to make a decent profit. She has many regular customers who trust in her products' quality and are satisfied with the affordable prices and the unparalleled service Nidia offers, since she is always attentive to her customers' wishes. Nidia is very active and very dedicated to her work. She has a great deal of fighting spirit and is always on the lookout for new opportunities to be successful. Demand has recently increased and, as any smart businesswoman would, Nidia wants to sell more, but does not have enough capital to meet this increase. This is why she turns to field partner INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy medicine wholesale. Nidia has an excellent credit history. She guarantees that she will be able to repay her loan and she knows she will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Gs La Aguja 3 Group

texts.es:
Doña Martha es una señora muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su trabajo, madre de un niño. Tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a Lo que es la fábrica de tortillas.
Doña Martha El préstamo lo necesita Para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que se ha descapitalizado. También ella da créditos en su negocio.
Doña Martha sus sueños son de poder darle a su hijo una educación de calidad. Para que tenga un mejor porvenir.
Milton se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace más de 6 años.
Pedro se dedica a su negocio propio de pulpería desde hace más de 15 años.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking woman, who is 100% committed to her work. She is mother to one son. She has a business in the home where she lives in the south of Honduras. For the past ten years she has made tortillas. Martha needs the loan to purchase corn, firewood, and quicklime. The loan will help her have fresh capital to invest since it has become undercapitalized. She also provides credit in her business. 

Martha’s dream is to give her son a quality education so that he can have a better future. 

Milton has sold firewood for over 6 years. 

Pedro has had his own corner store for over 15 years. 
Choluteca, Honduras – August 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and quicklime for her tortilla making business

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es:
La socia Stefany pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO ,la socia continua con su negocio de reposteria,la socia elabora tortas,pasteles entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia trabaja a pedido como matrimonios,bautizos,fiestas de 15 años entre otros,la socia a la vez continua con su otro negocio de movilidad escolar siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como harina,mantequilla y leche para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Stefany, belongs to the communal bank "Vallecito" (Little Valley).  She is still working with her baking business.  She makes pies, cakes and other items.  She has been in the business quite a while, and it has been going well thanks to the effort that she puts in.  Stefany takes orders for things like weddings, baptisms, "fiestas de 15 años" (a celebration for a girl turning 15 years old) and other occassions.  Stefany is also still working with her other business, a school transportation service.  In this way, she is able to help her family to get ahead.  Stefany is a responsible and hard-working person.  
The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies such as flour, butter and milk, for her business. 
The member is grateful for the loan she has been offered, and she promises to comply with her established re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, butter and milk for for business.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is 26 years old and a married lady.  She works in an office that provides decoration services. 

She started selling clothes at home.  She started doing this small business at home to support her husband and improve their living conditions.  Now she has applied for this youth loan to bring a new collection of clothes to increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Ibtihaj

texts.en:
Ibtihaj is a 32-year-old woman; she is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Ibtihaj has had a beauty salon, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs. Ibtihaj is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a collection of women accessories and a new beauty salon kit such as a number of hair dryers, different types of hair brushes, and a collection of hair and face creams. This will provide better quality to her loyal customers and increase sales and improve Ibtihaj's income, which will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family.

Ibtihaj is photographed in her salon.

loans.use: To purchase a new beauty salon kit and a new collection of accessories for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 55 years old, married and blessed with four children. He has owned a quarry business for the last seven years and gets an income of 17,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

He has a good credit history in KADET LTD., and he is applying for his fourth loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to buy equipment to be used for quarry work and also add another quarry site to meet the demand of his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy equipment and buy another quarry site.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind, 53 years old, is a  housewife who is helping her husband in supporting their family of seven members by selling clothes and dresses at home. She had a few customers to begin with, and through them, she is having more and more customers by word of mouth. 

Now, she is applying for this loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes and bring in a new collection that will fit with the autumn season.

loans.use: to bring in a new collection that will fit the autumn season.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old and single. 

To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She has been in the business for five years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business because she has been trained in business management skills.

Hellen has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy soda, cooking fat, and sugar.   She hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soda, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El comite San Gregorio, esta integrado por 15 mujeres dedicadas a actividades varias en su mayoría dedicadas a las ventas de productos como ropas, alimentos, frutas, etc. Las integrantes son muy responsables en sus plazos y en sus negocios.Las integrantes del comité están muy contentas con los resultados que pudieron observar y sobre todo que gracias a su esfuerzo pueden generar ingresos que les ayudan a mantener a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Lisa se dedica a la venta de lencerías para mujeres jóvenes y adultas. Ellas les ofrece ropa interior de mejor calidad y a un precio de bastante accesible para sus clientas. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías y de distintos tamaños para volver a venderlos y de esa forma tratar de generar mayor cantidad de ingresos posibles.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio Group consists of fifteen women who run different businesses. The majority of them sell products such as clothing, food, and fruit, etc. The members are very responsible with their loan payments and their businesses. The group’s members are very happy with the results they have seen, especially since thanks to their effort they are able to generate income which helps them provide for their families.
One of the members is Lisa, who sells lingerie for younger and older women. She offers better quality undergarments at a reasonable price for her customers.
The loan requested will be used to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise in different sizes so she can sell them and in this way try to generate the most revenue possible.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments.

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El comité Jesús Misericordioso esta compuesto por 12 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias, desde la venta de productos de limpieza a ama de casas. Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres trabajadoras, conscientes de sus necesidades  y por ello realizan actividades varias para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes la señora Juana se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace tiempo. La señora se despierta temprano y va al mercado local para comprar la mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para luego venderlas a sus clientes algunos ya fijos al mejor precio y mejor calidad posible. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar frutas de estación como manzanas, frutillas, naranjas, peras, etc y verduras como lechugas, tomates, berro, zanahorias, etc, todo el monto recibido  sería utilizado para re-invertir en su negocio y con los ingresos extras poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Jesús Misericordioso Group is comprised of 12 female members who are engaged in various activities, from the sale of cleaning products to working as a homemaker. All of the members of the group are working women who are aware of their needs and who therefore engage in various ventures in order to improve their quality of life and that of their families. 

One member of the gorup, Juana, has long worked selling fruits and vegetables. She gets up early and goes to the market to purchase wholesale fruits and vegetables to later sell the highest quality items at the best price to select customers. The loan sought will be used to buy seasonal fruits such as apples, bananas, strawberries, oranges, pears, etc.; as well as vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, watercress, carrots, etc. The amount received will be reinvested in her business and the extra revenue will go to improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits: apples, bananas, strawberries; and vegetables: lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a cereals seller in Nakuru town, and she has been in the business for the past 10 years.  She is 57 years old and a widow, with three grown children.

This will be her second loan amount.  She plans to buy more stocks of cereals, including beans, rice, and green grams. She will use the anticipated income to open a grocery store in the market place.

In the future, Esther hopes to buy a piece of land and do farming, as well as building a house.

loans.use: To buy more cereals, including beans, rice, and green grams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his inventory of beverages

loans.name: Maritza Soledad

texts.es: Maritza  Soledad, de 31 anos,  madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, todos están estudiando. Ella es  de la localidad de la paz centro, lugar  que se caracteriza por ser una zona de comida típicas como el quesillos, tiste, y la elaboración de ladrillos de tejas, además de ser un lugar muy acogedor por sus pobladores, gente muy humilde y sencillas, pero muy trabajadoras. Maritza Soledad tiene por actividad económica un  molino el cual consiste en dar el servicio a los pobladores de la  zona  para moler maíz  para la diferentes elaboraciones de comidas y bebidas típicas como: tiste, pinolillo, tamales, güirilas, (todos estos derivados del maíz) el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 anos, la experiencia  la adquirió de su mama  ya que su mama tenia este medio de vida. En la actualidad  el molino esta bajo la responsabilidad de Maritza ya que su mama se lo heredo  para que lo siquiera trabando por que hoy en día la mama ya es una señora de edad avanzada, cansada por los anos, enferma por lo tanto no puede seguir trabajando. A pesar de todos estos obstáculos el negocio ha salido adelante. Gracias al apoyo que los prestatarios kiva les brinda a personas de países pobre y  con pocos recursos económicos como lo es Nicaragua para que sus habitantes tengan un medio digno para sobrevivir. el financiamiento lo quiere para darle mantenimieno a su molino y brindar el servicio necesario a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maritza Soledad is thirty-one, a single mother with three young children who are all in school. She lives in Paz Centro, which is an area with many traditional specialities such as cheesecake, tiste (a sweetcorn and cocoa drink), and the making of tile bricks. The people are very welcoming, humble and simple, but very hardworking. Maritza has an industrial grinder, which she rents out to people in the area who need to grind sweetcorn in order to make all the various typical foods that use it as an ingredient: tiste, pinolillo (a similar drink, but sweeter), tamales, güirilas (a sort of sweetcorn pancake). She keeps the grinder in her house and has been in this line of business for ten years. Her mother taught her how to operate the grinder and derive an income from it. Her mother, who is now very old and sick, gave it to her so that she could continue the family business. In spite of these difficulties, Maritza's business is faring reasonably well. She thanks Kiva lenders for the help they bring to people in poor countries with little income such as Nicaragua, enabling them to make a living by decent means. Maritza needs the money to invest in maintenance for her industrial grinder and keep offering good service to her clients.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance for her industrial grinder and keep offering good service to her clients.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a conservative married woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo since they also help each other in their small business, which is a toys and accessories shop. 

Rola has applied for this loan in order to fill the shop with more toys and accessories to make more profits, especially in the holiday season.

loans.use: to fill the shop with more toys and accessories.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of one child aged 4 years. She operates a grocery store and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for sale.

She hopes to expand her business and start sales on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Dilenia Lizeth

texts.es:
La joven Dilenia de 33 años de edad, es madre de un hijo, su conyugue vive en los estados unidos, ella vive en su casa  con su hijo ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace unos años al negocio de golosinas también vende tortillas y comidas.
Dilenia esta solicitando el préstamo de 10,000.00 lempiras para comprar material para una pequeña papelería que desea abrir, ya que en esa zona se vende bastante los Refrescos, Huevos, Embutidos, Lácteos, manteca, harina, café, pan, materiales escolares, y también desea comprar carnes, verduras para continuar con su negocio de golosinas.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo desea emprender este nuevo negocio que desea iniciar y seguir invirtiendo en lo de las golosinas y tortillas.
Dilenia su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Dilenia, who is thirty-three years old, is the mother of one child. Her husband lives in the United States, while she lives with her son in their house, which is located in the community of Nacaome in southern Honduras. For several years she has worked selling sweets, as well as tortillas and other food. 
Dilenia is requesting a loan of 10, 000 lempira [$525 US] to purchase supplies for a small stationary shop that she would like to open, since in her region plenty of soft drinks, eggs, sausage, dairy products, butter, flour, coffee, bread, and school supplies are sold. She would also like to purchase meat and vegetables to continue her business selling sweets.
She hopes to start this new business that she would like to start with the help of this loan. She also hopes to continue investing in her business selling sweets and tortillas.
Dilenia’s dream is to improve her house.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – August 2012.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, eggs, sausage, dairy products, butter, flour, coffee, bread, and school supplies. She also would like to purchase meat and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento YUNGUEÑITAS, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Sulema tiene 25 años, tiene un hijo que es de la  edad de 6 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de zapatillas deportivas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona comercial de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Sulema  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de zapatillas por cantidad así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Sulema va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y surtiendo su negocio, la Sra. Sulema  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Yuguenitas is composed of 8 members—7 women and one man. The president of the group is Sulema, who is 25 and has an 8 year old son. 

Sulema sells sports shoes, and her place of sales is in the commercial zone of the city La Paz. Sulema is going to use the loan to purchase shoes in bulk, thereby offering a better service to her clients and increasing her earnings. She is asking for the loan in order to continue improving her business. Sulema is going to use the funds to continue purchasing merchandise and stocking her business. She is a hardworking woman and feels happy for the opportunity provided her. In some cases, the members of the group are the sole support for their families.

loans.use: purchase sports shoes in bulk

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a 31-year-old man; he is married and a father to seven children.

For the past three years, Abdulrahman has been operating a smithy workshop (blacksmith), which has been a profitable project, but also is not enough to cover his cost of living.

Abdulrahman is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new blacksmith kit and a large quantity of raw iron. This will improve Abdulrahman's work quality and increase demand from his customers. This will increase his income and offer to him and his family better living conditions. Abdulrahman is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new blacksmith kit and raw iron.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia Ana pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO,la socia continua con su negocio de restaurante,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende lo que son almuerzos que consta de una sopa y un segundo como arroz con pollo,saltado,estofados entre otros,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio para de esta manera poder apoyar economicamente a sus hijos,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como aceite y arroz.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank VALLECITO. She continues to run her restaurant business. She has spent several years running this business, which is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells lunch menus which consist of soup and a main course, such as chicken and rice, stir-fried steak, and stew, among others. She works every day so that she will be able to support her children economically. She is a responsible and determined person, since this is how she is helping her family to get ahead.
Ana is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for her business such as oil and rice.
Ana is grateful for the loan she has received, and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business such as oil and rice.

loans.name: Olatoutou

texts.fr: Olatoutou est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale à Lomé et se fait aider par un employé. Elle est mariée à un employé de société et ont 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Face à un problème d’insuffisance de capital, elle sollicite son troisième crédit qui sera consacré à son commerce auprès de notre institution. Elle souhaite avoir sa propre boutique et si possible construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en: Olatoutou is a retail grocer in Lomé and is helped by an employee. She is married to a man employed at a private company, and they have three children, all in school. Facing the problem of insufficient capital, Olatoutou is requesting from our institution her third loan that will be dedicated to her business. She would like to have her own store and if possible build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Modoukpe

texts.fr: Epouse de soudeur à Lomé, Modukpè achète des produits cosmétiques qu’elle revend dans sa boutique. Elle est âgée de 27 ans et est mère d’un enfant de 07 ans scolarisé. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit auprès de notre institution pour l’agrandissement de son stock et la revalorisation de son seul activité génératrice de revenu. Elle compte ouvrir une seconde  boutique et assurer ainsi le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Married to a welder in Lomé, Modukpè purchases cosmetics that she sells in her shop. She is 27 years old and the mother of a 7-year-old child, who is in school. She is requesting her third loan from our institution to expand her stock and to enhance her only revenue-generating business. She plans on opening a second shop, thus to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various sacks of garlic to begin selling this product.

loans.name: Elvin David

texts.es:
El joven Elvin es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el Departamento de Choluteca. Elvin Se dedica a su negocio propio de pulpería.
Elvin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carne, pollo, café, azúcar, harina, refrescos, jugos, huevos, pan y leche. Elvin Espera tener en 5 años un mini súper ya que es una zona muy productiva de mariscos, ganadería y otro tipo de actividades comerciales.
Elvin su deseo es seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darles a sus hijos lo mejor que es la educación para que sean personas de bien.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Elvin is a very hard-working person. Currently, he lives with his wife and their two children in the department of Choluteca. Elvin has his own business running a general store.
Elvin is requesting a loan to purchase meat, chicken, coffee, sugar, flour, soft drinks, juice, eggs, bread, and milk. Elvin hopes to have a mini supermarket in five years, since he lives in a region that produces lots of seafood and livestock, and is the home of other types of commercial activities.
Elvin’s wish is to continue working hard to be able to give his children the best in life, which is an education so that they can become better people.
Choluteca, Honduras – August 2012.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, coffee, sugar, flour, soft drinks, juice, eggs, bread, and milk for his business.

loans.name: Xenia Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Xenia pertenece la banco comunal VALLECITO,la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras y fruta,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia compra su mercaderia en Cusco para luego enviarlo a sus clientes que tiene en Puerto Maldonado como zanahorias,tomates,platanos,papayas entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como zanahorias y tomates.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Xenia is a member of the communal bank VALLECITO.  She continues with her business of buying and selling vegetables and fruit.  She does well in this business, thanks to her dedication to her work.  She buys her products, like carrots, tomatoes, plantains, and papayas, among others, in Cusco and later mails them to her customers in Puerto Maldonado.  Xenia is a responsible and diligent person and feels that in this way she can help her family to get ahead.

Xenia asked for this loan to buy products like carrots and tomatoes.

She feels grateful for this offered loan and promises to complete the agreed repayments.

loans.use: to buy products like carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Livia

texts.en:
Livia is 38 years old and is married to David and they are blessed with three children. She has had a tailoring and dress-making business for the past eight years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES.12,800.

She has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan of KES.60,000 which she will use to buy materials and tailoring accessories.

She will use the anticipated profit to meet their basic needs, pay her children's school fees, and grow her business in the future to ensure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To add stock like tailoring accessories.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the village of Kalauri, Kakheti Region. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in her house. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and peach garden. Nino and her husband do all the proper seasonal works to get a good harvest. They pick the fruits and sell locally. In addition, they have milk cows and sell milk in their village.

Nino requested a loan to buy a liquid gas tank and purchase liquid gas. She will sell liquid gas in her village at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income Nino will improve her living conditions and renovate her house, which is old and damaged. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a liquid gas tank and purchase liquid gas

loans.name: Mulwa

texts.en: Mulwa lives in the coastal region of Kenya with his family - his wife and their four children. For the last 10 years, Mulwa has operated a clothes-selling business, selling used bed sheets. He is a dedicated man who is devoted to his job, despite the various adversaries he at times passes through. He sells his merchandise at the market. Mulwa says that his customers have requested a variety of sheets but he does not have enough capital to cater to these needs. For this reason then, he is asking for a loan to buy bales of used clothes for sale. He hopes to increase his sales even as he continues to pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of housewares

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en: Diogene is 28 years old. He sells handbags and has been in the business for five years. He wants this loan to buy more handbags for sale. He plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: to buy more handbags for sale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant, Holali est un jeune détaillant ambulant de cartes de recharge et de kits de connexion. Il sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de notre institution pour l’investir dans son commerce et pour diversifier les produits de sa distribution. Il envisage de mobiliser ses profits pour disposer d’un point de vente en tant que grossiste. Ce qui lui permettra de stabiliser son activité et  préparer éventuellement  la venue de sa future épouse.
texts.en: Unmarred and without children, Holali is a young retailer selling mobile phone recharge cards and connection kits door to door. He is requesting his third loan from our institution to invest in his business and to diversify the products in his distribution. He envisions making use of his profits to establish sales outlets as a wholesaler. This will enable him to stabilize his business and possibly prepare for a wife in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone recharge cards and some connection kits

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
La joven Blanca es muy persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio propio actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Blanca el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de lociones, talcos, cremas, aretes y otros productos de uso personal.
Blanca espera que con este préstamo tener más ventas. Sus sueños es de graduar a sus hijos, y también poner otro negocio igual para poder ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Young Blanca is a very enterprising person dedicated to her own business.  Currently she lives with her spouse and their 3 children in the department of Choluteca, south of Honduras.  Her business is the sale of cosmetics.

Blanca needs this loan to buy lotions, talc powders, creams, earrings and other products of personal use.

Blanca hopes to have more sales with this loan.  Her dreams are for her children to graduate and also to have another business like her current one so that she can help her family since they have scarce economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy lotions, talc powders, creams, earring and other products of personal use for her business

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 33 years old and lives in Abasha district with her family which includes her husband, 3 children (aged 2, 11 and 14) and mother-in-law. Two of her children attend the local school. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land, where nuts, watermelons and maize are grown. Lela sells her agricultural production at the local open market. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has 7 milk cows. Lela milks the cows and produces cheese, which is sold locally. 

She is requesting a loan to build a cattle-shed. She plans to expand the dairy farm by adding additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the cattle-shed is built, Lela will be able to expand her dairy farm and increase her sales. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, she plans to finance her children's education and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to build a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is 26 years old from Gaza. She is married and lives with her husband. She asked Ryada for this startup loan in order to open a beauty salon through buying furniture, hairdryers, dyes, mirrors and chairs. She hopes that this loan will help her in improving her family's income.

The one who appears in the photo is Hadeel's husband since she declined to have a picture taken due to culture beliefs.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises – not for existing businesses. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources for at least 50 percent of the startup costs. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start a beauty salon through buying furniture, hairdryers, dyes, mirrors and chairs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 61 years old, married, and has four children. He owns rental houses, which earn him a living. He has been in the business for over 10 years. 

Through his previous loans from Faulu Kenya, he has managed to construct more rental units. Stephen hopes to own large apartments in the future. He has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate his rental homes

loans.name: Nyamai

texts.en: Nyamai earns a living designing and selling shoes in a small store that is located in a strategic place along one of the busy streets of the town of Likoni, Kenya. He is a married man responsible for caring for his beautiful wife and their single bouncing baby boy. Nyamai has been in business for the past six years and he has gained enough experience to design any shoe style his customers request. He has shown responsibility because his wife has not lacked any basic needs since they started living together. Nyamai has received many orders but he does not have enough materials to make shoes. With this requested loan, he will be able to purchase leather for making more shoes.

loans.use: to purchase leather to make more shoes

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 20-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one child. Her husband works for the Lebanese army to support the family money-wise. But since his income is not enough to cover the family's expenses, Israa decided to start working as a hairdresser, receiving customers at her house. She’s a brave young woman who is running a business while at the same time raising her child and taking care of her house. 

With her requested youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies so as to better serve her clients. She hopes her business will grow and dreams to be able to give her child a good future and high educational degree through all her hard work.

loans.use: purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies so as to better serve her clients

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 30 years old. She is married with three children, aged between two and seven. She has been selling fruits for the past 12 years. With the loan, she will buy more fruits for selling. The profits from the business will be used to go towards savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is married to a businessman. They have one child, aged one. Clarisse has been running the business of selling clothes for five years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man living with his wife and four children. They are all attending school. He’s a 39-year-old hard worker looking to satisfy the family needs.

Ali has many years of experience in his present job.  He’s an independent painter who works upon client requests. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best quality ever. He’s known for being well-organized and punctual. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase different colors of paint and the needed tools and supplies. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his work and take bigger projects. Ali is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take more projects, maybe outside the country, if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase different colors of paint and the needed tools and supplies

loans.name: Kokouda

texts.fr: Kokouda est revendeur de tôles ondulées depuis 1999. Il est marié et a 04 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 12 ans et le second a 4 ans. Il sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de notre institution pour s’approvisionner en tôles ondulées et satisfaire la demande  qui est croissante sur le marché. Actuellement il dispose d’un étalage et espère avoir bientôt une boutique dont il sera propriétaire.
texts.en: Kokouda has been a retailer of corrugated sheet metal since 1999. He is married  and has four children, all in school. He is requesting his third loan from our institution to stock up on corrugated sheet metal and to satisfy the growing market demand. He currently has a display of goods and hopes soon to have a store where he is the owner.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated sheet metal to sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – предприниматель из малого сектора, работающая в городе Мелитополе. Она занимается торговлей промтоварами на привокзальном рынке. У нее есть собственное торговое место. Опыт работы составляет 16 лет. Наиболее ходовыми товарами в ее бизнесе можно назвать электротовары и хозтовары. 
Елена планирует вложить предложенные от КИВА средства в размере 5 000 гривен в закупку дополнительной партии товара на следующий сезон. Елена – очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. Она планирует последовательно развивать свое дело, вкладывая в бизнес, и со временем надеется достроить свой дом.
texts.en:
Yelena runs a small business in the city of Melitopol. She sells household goods at a railroad station market. Yelena has her own market stall. She has been in this business for 16 years. Her most popular merchandise is consumer electronics and housewares.
Yelena plans to invest the 5,000 UAH loaned by Kiva into buying an extra batch of merchandise for next season. Yelena is very responsible and hard-working. She plans to grow her business consistently and invest in it so she can eventually finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy an extra batch of merchandise for next season

loans.name: Rosa Erminda

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos, es madre soltera, ella y su familia viven en el Departamento de Choluteca. Doña Rosa se dedica a su negocio propio de venta de comida.
Doña Rosa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes, condimentos, maíz y verduras. Ella espera que al finalizar el esta época de verano su negocio comience a crecer.
Doña Rosa sus deseos son seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darle a sus hijos lo mejor que es la educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hardworking person. She is a single mother and she lives with her 2 children in the Choluteca department. Rosa runs her own food selling activity.
Rosa is requesting a loan to buy meat, dressings, corn and vegetables. She hopes that her activity will start growing at the end of the summer.
Rosa wishes to keep on working hard in order to continue paying for the education of her children, as she considers this to be the best for them.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2012

loans.use: To buy meat, dressings, corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Sosa Kue Group

texts.es:
El comité Sosa Kue esta integrado por 11 mujeres que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a actividades varias pero, la mayoría se dedican a las ventas en general. Las integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy satisfechas con los resultados.
Una de las integrantes la señora Blanca se dedica a la venta de Bijouteries como pulseras, collares, aros muy lindos, creativos a un precio accesible para las mujeres que les gusta vestir bien. 
El crédito solicitado sería para re invertir en su propio negocio comprando hilos, canutillos de varios colores, dijes, etc. 
.
texts.en:
The Sosa Kue communal bank is comprised of 11 women who live in the same community.  They devote themselves to various business activities, but most of them work in general sales.  The members of the group are very happy with their results.

Blanca is one of the members.  She sells costume jewelry like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings.  They are very pretty and creative, and she sells them at a price that is accessible for women who like to dress well.

The requested loan will be to invest in her own business by purchasing thread, various colors of glass beads, and charms, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread, various colors of glass beads, pendants, and charms, etc.

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es:
EL socio Juan Benito pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO,el socio tiene 45 años,03 hijos y es conviviente,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpinteria ,el lleva años en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio realiza diferentes modelos como camas,reposteros,armarios,comodas entre otros, su taller se encuentra ubicado en su casa,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que le socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de madera para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juan Benito is a member of the communal bank Vallecito.  He is 45 years old, he has 3 children, and he is married.  He works daily in his carpentry business.  He has worked for many years in his business and it has gone well, thanks to the work that his job brings him every day.  

He makes different furniture pieces from wood such as bed frames, wardrobes, cabinets, shelves, and other things like this.  His workshop is in his home.

He is a responsible and hard-working man and feels that these are the traits that help his family get ahead.

He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase wood for his business.  He is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wood for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri is from Gurjaani district, East Georgia. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband. Eteri’s husband is a pensioner. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land, where peaches are grown. They also own a vineyard and pick grapes during the late summer. Eteri sells the fruits locally. She runs a small animal husbandry business as well and has a horse and a pig. She is very hardworking person, with great experience in her work.

Eteri requested a loan to purchase calves. She plans to raise the cattle and then sell them at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Eteri will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves for selling

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mazen, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Linda is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to Mazen and is a mother to three sons and one daughter.

For the past ten years, Linda's husband has been operating a flower store, which has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover the family's cost of living. Linda is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of artificial flowers and a machine to paste flowers and make different designs. This will improve their work's quality and attract customers to buy. This will increase Linda's husband's income and offer the family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of artificial flowers and a machine to paste flowers and make different designs

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 28 years old and is married to Mercy. They are blessed with one child aged two years. Gerald has been doing transport and selling charcoal as a secondary business for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 20,000.

He is applying for his first business loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Gerald will use the loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle and add more stock of charcoal to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to own a chain of public transport vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle and add more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is taking out a new loan so as to expand her existing business and improve on the new ventures. 

She included coconuts and snacks selling in her previous business.   She plans to purchase more stock of coconuts and two sacks of groundnuts.  

Mesaid is thankful to Yehu and Kiva for their support. She is doing well, and she says she hopes to move forward with these loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of coconuts and two sacks of groundnuts.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and only one child. She has worked as a private teacher since 2010.
